intro: Phtheirospermum tenuisectum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phtheirospermum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. The seeds are enclosed in a hairy, spiny capsule that aids in seed dispersal by attaching to animals or clothing.
